result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Thomas Phelps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 2 years - fine/costs $969.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt - AODA treatment and any follow thru - DNA sample & Surcharge - Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.

miscConds.notes: Fine $719.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Surcharge $250.00    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Thomas Phelps in court with attorney Stephen Zuber.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1 and dismissed and read-in counts 2 and 3.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - fine/costs $969.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt - AODA treatment and any follow thru - DNA sample & Surcharge - Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Steven Thomas Phelps in court with attorney Stephen Zuber appearing by phone.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Acknowledges receipt of Information.  Not Guilty Plea entered.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven Thomas Phelps in court with attorney Stephen Zuber via phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zuber waived right to a prelim.  DE does wish to waive prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam - finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Thomas Phelps in court with attorney Stephen Zuber appearing by phone.   Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven Thomas Phelps in court with attorney Stephen Zuber appeared by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.    Court enters NG Plea on Counts 2 & 3.    Counsel/DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  SIBS $1000   Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
